p:
A tipping point “refers to a critical threshold at which a tiny perturbation can qualitatively alter the state or development of a system”
1 . In relation to Earth’s systems, such as the climate, a tipping point is a critical juncture at which the system responds nonlinearly to a small change in forcing, significantly altering future states
1, 2 . A key climate tipping point has been projected to occur if global temperatures rise beyond 1.5 °C above pre-industrial levels, at which point threats to health, food security, water supply, economic growth, and geopolitical stability are expected to increase appreciably
